alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 4:30AM EDT until October 02 at 12:48AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins with numerous roads and residences affected. Evacuations may be needed along various roads in Avon and Simsbury, including Riverside Road in Simsbury. Flooding also begins to affect low lying sections of Bloomfield and East Granby. Follow the directions of emergency management officials and obey all road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 530 AM EDT.
